title: Legal Hacks
transcript: Another ISP's filtering content. Thank God for Crypto. It wasn't that long ago that RSA was illegal to export. Classified a munition. You know, I think the crypto community took the wrong side in that fight. We should've lobbied to keep it counted as a weapon. Why? Once they get complacent, we break out the second amendment....Damn.
altTitle: It's totally a reasonable modern analogue.  Jefferson would have been all about crypto.

title: The BDLPSWDKS Effect
transcript: Ponytail: The Bernoulli-Doppler-Leidenfrost-Peltzman-Sapir-Whorf-Dunning-Kruger-Stroop Effect states that if a speeding fire truck lifts off and hurtles towards you on a layer of superheated gas, you'll dive out of the way faster if the driver screams "red!" in a non-tonal language that has a word for "firefighter" than if they scream "green!" in a tonal language with no word for "firefighter" which you think you're fluent in but aren't.
altTitle: This well-known effect has of course been replicated in countless experiments.

title: Beliefs
transcript: Professor, that man claims the earth is 6,000 years old! So? Just use your head and don't concern yourself overmuch with what other people think. But he says the fossils in the mountains were put there in a flood! Well, evidence suggests that they were not. But he-- Professor (off-panel): A million people can call the mountains a fiction, yet it need not trouble you as you stand atop them. But he believes the silliest things! So? The universe doesn't care what you believe.  The wonderful thing about science is that it doesn't ask for your faith, it just asks for your eyes. But he's a US senator! Ah, then yes, we do have a bit of a situation.
altTitle: Scientists are also sexy, let's not forget that.

title: Hand Sanitizer
transcript: An invisible sneeze droplet can contain 200 million germs! Our hand sanitizer kills 99.99% of germs! Cueball (typing on calculator): 200 000 000 × 0.01% = Ew.
altTitle: Hipster CDC Reports Flu Epidemic Peaked Years Ago

title: Archimedes
transcript: In the words of Archimedes, Give me a long enough lever and a place to rest it Or I will kill one hostage every hour.
altTitle: Give a man a fish, or he will destroy the only existing vial of antidote.

title: Particle Properties
altTitle: Each particle also has a password which allows its properties to be changed, but the cosmic censorship hypothesis suggests we can never observe the password itself—only its secure hash.

title: Solar System Changes
transcript: Changes I Would Make to the Solar System  Add mysterious planets inside Mercury's orbit After what it's been through, Venus deserves rings and a moon Replace our moon with Mars. Mars is more interesting and we can consolidate missions. The Solar System needs a super-Earth More asteroids! Merge the big planet and the ringed planet into a big ringed planet ("Jaturn") Cut Uranus. Uranus and Neptune are redundant and Neptune is better. Tough but fair. Settle the planet thing by making Pluto a moon of Neptune
altTitle: "Actually, Jupiter already has a very impressive ring system!" --someone who knows Jupiter is within earshot

title: Family Reunion
transcript: 14th cousin2nd cousinMe12th cousin35th cousin17,000,000th cousin9th cousin50,000,000,000th cousin Really, every gathering is a family reunion.
altTitle: Grandma says that because of differences in primate and feline lifespans, the cat is actually my 17,000,000th cousin 14,000,000 times removed.

title: Tinder
transcript:
If you know how
to fly a plane
please swipe
right ASAP
altTitle: People keep telling me to use the radio but I really hate making voice calls.

title: Manual Override
transcript:
"This is the emergency override system, which can be used to regain control of the aircraft.
Complete instructions for activating this system are available as a GNU info page."
altTitle: I think you mean 'GNU Info Override'.

title: Screws
transcript: Phillips headFlat headUh oh. Maybe it's on Amazon?Cursed -1 Phillips headCrap, it's a rivet.Phillips-head ruinerUranium screw (a real thing)Phillip's head
altTitle: If you encounter a hex bolt, but you only brought screwdrivers, you can try sandwiching the head of the bolt between two parallel screwdriver shafts, squeezing the screwdrivers together with a hand at either end, then twisting. It doesn't work and it's a great way to hurt yourself, but you can try it!

title: Babies
transcript: It doesn't seem right that we're old enough to have kids.Sweet! We made a baby! Are we sure we did it right? We should disassemble it, check all the parts, and put it back together.
altTitle: I bet my future kids will read this someday.  DEAR FUTURE KIDS: how did you get internet in the cellar?

title: Error Code
transcript: "Error -41"? That's helpful. It doesn't even say which program it's from! -41? I'll look it up... It says -41 is: "Sit by a lake."    I don't know where you got that book, but I like it. Hasn't been wrong yet.
altTitle: It has a section on motherboard beep codes that lists, for each beep pattern, a song that syncs up well with it.
